name: karpe diem: useless goldfish monster hat
notes:
note: this pattern is offered as is. thank you all for the comments pointing out corrections, but i will not be updating this pattern as i'm really bad at counting. also, like edna mode, "i never look back darling, it distracts from the now." 

*gotta catch 'em all!*

and if you catch 101 of these you might have enough magikarp candy to evolve it into a gyarados!^

my version of a magikarp hat, because one can never have enough magikarps. this pattern is best suited to intermediate to experienced crafters as it involves a range of crochet stitches, multiple individual pieces and lots and lots of counting.

stitches used: slst, dc, dc2tog, htr, tr, tr2tog fptr, magic ring

**caution! this pattern has not been beta tested.** stitches have been counted to the best of my ability, but there is a reason iâ€™m not a mathematician (or a census taker). your results may vary; proceed with care!

** erratum: the pattern is actually in uk crochet symbols.**

** erratum 2: argh! i messed up on the pattern for the dorsal fin. the increases in the pattern are meant to be decreases. shoot me now.**

*^hat will not evolve into a gyarados. i mean, seriously?*
